item.title: With Possible Iran Strike Looming, U.S. Says Staff Can Leave Israel, and Urges Speed
item.summary: In an email to embassy workers Friday morning, Ambassador Mike Huckabee warned them that if they wanted to leave Israel, they “should do so TODAY.”

item.title: Israel Facing Prospect of War With a Depleted Missile Defense
item.summary: The June 2025 conflict with Iran depleted Israeli and U.S. stocks of antiballistic missiles. If there is another war, the pressure will be on to destroy Iranian missiles before they can be launched.

item.title: Trump Says He’s ‘Not Happy’ With Progress of Iran Talks
item.summary: The president expressed his negative view of the status of nuclear talks as he weighed military strikes against Iran.

item.title: Iran’s Students Are Protesting Again. Here’s Why.
item.summary: The unrest underlines the intensity of domestic discontent, even as Tehran’s government grapples with the threat of U.S. strikes. Here’s what to know.

item.title: Pakistan Strikes Afghanistan in ‘Open War’ Against Taliban Regime
item.summary: The airstrikes came hours after Afghan troops had attacked Pakistani border positions and follow months of worsening relations between the neighboring countries.

item.title: A Trump Call Ignited Saudi-U.A.E. Feud
item.summary: A request made to President Trump about the war in Sudan is at the heart of a diplomatic dispute between Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates.

item.title: Iranians Cite Progress in Talks, but a Marathon Session Produces No Deal
item.summary: Representatives of the countries were in Geneva this week to discuss the fate of Iran’s nuclear program.

item.title: Hungary Plays Spoiler in Europe as Orban Strains for Votes at Home
item.summary: Facing a serious election challenge, Prime Minister Viktor Orban is holding up a big E.U. loan for Ukraine. Analysts say the timing is no coincidence.

item.title: Some Russians Go Without Heat or Power in Winter, as Energy System Falls Into Disrepair
item.summary: A dozen major blackouts and central heating cutoffs across the country have affected hundreds of thousands during a brutal winter.

item.title: After a Speedboat Shootout in Cuba, There are More Questions Than Answers
item.summary: The Cuban government’s account of a supposed armed raid into its territory was called into question after one of the men identified as being on the boat turned up in Miami.
